column1: back of a length at middle, pitches on that big green patch in the middle and goes down leg. Rahim dives to his left. An appeal, which is turned down, and then a plea from Guptill who swears that didn't come off the thigh and wants a wide
back of a length at off stump, nicely behind the line to defend this into the off side
good length, off stump, waits for it to come on defends later under his eyes
good length, off stump, nice big stride and pushed to mid-off

edge flies wide of the solitary slip. This well bowled. Angles in at a length on off stump, straightens slightly and has Guptill fending at it. It's a thick outside edge that third man has to cut off in the end
good length, in the corridor, slight angle in but Ronchi is confident he has covered the off stump and lets this go
some swing into the bat, full and from outside off. Guptill reaches the pitch and opens the face at the last moment to squeeze this past point. In the air but safe
nice. More control this time. Leans into this outside off and punches it past the cover fielder
full and on the pads, stands tall and pushes this past midwicket. Timed well, but the heavy outfield grips this ball tight. He comes back for the third
back of a length, slanted across the right hander, and he lets it go to the keeper
good length, off stump, tapped into point with an open face
good length, slight shape in at off stump. Watchfully pushed back to the bowler on the bounce
teasing stuff from Mortaza. Good length, just outside off stump, but there's carry on this pitch. Guptill happy to leave
back of a length in the corridor, stands tall to try and slash this though the off side, gets it into the turf off the toe-end
nips this back in from outside off stump, Guptill leaves another good leave
good length at off stump, well forward this time to punch it to mid-off
back of a length outside off, tries to punch this off his toes but it keeps a touch low. Dribbles through to mid-on
shot. But it's a maiden. Gets the punch right this time, but he finds mid-off
overpitched outside off stump, leans into it and pokes it into the covers. Slight hesitation but he got it sufficiently to the fielder's right
angled across off stump again, full and wide, pushed to mid-off's left off the front foot
zip. From a length on middle stump. Classic Mustafizur. Ronchi pokes, without feet, and is beaten outside off stump
back of a length on off stump, tapped into the covers on the up
good looking shot. Hangs back in the crease and picks this length ball against the angle, gets it over midwicket
smashed that! Fizz goes wide with this, it's at a nice hitting length, and Ronchi clears the arms to slap this over point

oh wow. No respect there, for sure. This is a length ball at off stump, not different from what he's been doing so far. Guptill sees it coming, has his stride leg side of this ball and creams this on the up over the long-off boundary

he sticks to his line and length, but Guptill is all over him how. This is back of a length in the corridor, and there's a hint of movement away off the pitch. Doesn't bother the batsman, slaps this between point and cover point
offcutter at a length, off stump, stretches forward nicely and defends this
offcutter again, good length at off stump. Gets the stride in early and then adjusts to defend this back down the pitch
back of a length at middle stump, punched to long-on on the up
offcutter picked early. Puts in a good stride outside off and drives this firmly, but the bowler gets a hand and mid-off gets across
beaten. This skids through in the channel from back of a length. Guptill looks to punch through the line, but he plays inside it and is beaten
overpitched outside off stump, can't get enough timing on this drive, mid-off cleans up
leaps down the pitch and makes too much room. Taskin throws it wide off stump on a good length and gets this to slide through from under the bat
stays put this time, watches the overpitched ball nicely, and picks the gap in the covers with a drive
back of a length in the corridor, arches slightly and chops this wide of third man
bouncer, nicely directed. It flies inwards and forces Ronchi to get out of the way quickly. Barely carries though
he's no broom, but he's got rid of the rubbish. Short and wide and Guptill has no issues drilling this through extra cover
good length at off stump, behind the line, defended
back of a length at off stump, minimal movement away, tapped off the back foot to mid-off

skews this over the off side infield, but he's safe. Once again, he's made too much room. This is a good length ball slightly outside off, and he's reached out to it from outside leg stump after stepping out
back of a length at off stump, firmly punched off the back foot, straight to extra cover
full, off stump, front leg out of the way to punch this back down the pitch. To mid-off via bowler's fingertips

breakthrough! Ronchi mistimes again. Taskin's pace is the reason. This is back of a length at off stump, and he wants to swipe this through midwicket with no intention of keeping it down. But that comes on quick, gets him high on the bat, and it's a simple lob to mid-on
good length at off stump, gets behind the line and drops this into the point region with soft hands
good length, off stump, a slight shuffle and a full stride, defended
back of a length outside off, opens the face away from the body and runs this down to third man
nice, tight line. Angled in at off stump on a good length, defended into the off side
good length, off stump, forward push to mid-off
back of a length, takes it a touch away from off stump. Williamson on his toes to flick this, but is a bit squared in the end. Pushes it to mid-on
oh, beauty. How classy is this guy? Back of a length outside off stump, goes back and across but also a tad low to caress this past point
good length at off stump, defended into the off side with a half stride
back of a length, angled into the batsman. He shapes for a forward defence, then opens the face at the last moment to push this past backward point
good length at off stump, offcutter, waits for it to come on and taps it past the bowler
oh, loose from Williamson. This is short and wide and he's looked to poke at this with minimal feet. It skids past the outside edge
good length at off stump, forward stride, defended to mid-off
back of a length at off stump, gets on his toes, drops it into the leg side with soft hands. Neatly done
back of a length in the corridor, mistimed punch back down the pitch
sweet. Nice high elbow as he meets this length ball outside off and punches it past mid-off
loose again. Straight, back of a length outside off, he pokes once more. He's beaten once more.
full at off stump, pushed to mid-off off the front foot, slightly late on that drive
slings this in, back of a length, outside off, and strikes the bat hard as he looks to punch this
back of a length outside off stump, no error this time, lets it go
edge and another one evades slip! Good, quick stuff from Rubel. Gets it to straighten in the corridor, forces hard hands and the edge, but once more it's third man who is at the end of this
back of a length, off stump, defended off the back foot
full outside off stump, leans into try and drive this through the covers, but he's playing to far away. Bat turns, ball back at the bowler
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
yikes. That jags in sharply after pitching, but it's also past the stumps before moving as Williamson leaves this ball outside off
back of a length outside off and this one moves away, Williamson lets it go
short and wide outside off, looks to cut, under-edges it into the off side
good length outside off stump, Williamson away from the body once more. Hardly a stride and beaten on the outside edge again
good length outside off stump, spits back into the batsman, hits him outside the line on his back thigh
back of a length, climbs and nips back in sharply, Williamson gets it onto his thigh again, off the inside edge
back of a length outside off, watches it onto his bat and dabs this wide of third man
back of a length outside off stump, looks to run this down, but it's high on the bat and first slip cuts it off
oh, he gives him a release and he won't get away. A generous full ball on the toes with an open leg side field. Williamson picks the V - tucks this wide of mid-on
short and wide this time, well outside off. Climbs into this cut and finds sweeper

he's gone! Dead straight and probably crashing into middle stump. Good length, aimed for off stump, but comes in with his natural angle. Guptill plays down the wrong line and is well beaten for pace. A short mid-pitch discussion with his captain, and they won't review. Great bowling
bouncer, too short and down the leg side, he ducks under it
back of a length outside off stump, pushed into the off side on the up
yorker at middle stump...jams it out to mid-on and nearly collides with his partner mid-pitch. All safe in the end
good length at off stump, nips back in, defended back down the pitch
back of a length outside off, climbs sharply as he lets it go
full at middle stump, pushed to mid-on off the front foot
another release ball. Goes for the yorker, it ends up a juicy full toss at leg stump, Taylor punches it past wide mid-on
ohhhhh yessssss. Yes. So good. Full and aimed for middle stump, he gets a short stride at this, offers the full face and taps this between his partner and the non-strikers stumps
back of a length outside off stump, punches off the back foot to sweeper cover
back of a length outside off stump, looks to cut, late on it. Slices it off the outside half to third man
good length, in the corridor, poked watchfully into the covers
back of a length, off stump, solidly defended off the back foot
thud. Williamson looks to flick this back of a length ball, it's pacey and it's straight into his thigh guard
awwww yesssss! Good length outside off, and this time he takes it away from the forward defence. Beats the outside edge
Tayor gallops down the track, tries to unsettle Shakib. The left-armer holds his own. Pulls his length back and keeps Taylor to a single. Dropped gently towards square leg
darted in short on middle, skids on with the arm, back-foot drive to long-on. Smooth from Williamson
picked off the pads to short fine leg
full and straight, knocked just wide of Mustafiz at short fine leg for one
skids into leg stump, Williamson has time to step back and punch it calmly past the right of midwicket
pushed through on off, no turn, Williamson backs away outside leg and eases a single
pitched up and outside off, Williamson drives through the line and finds mid-off
back of a length and outside off, Williamson waits for the ball to arrive. Picks it at the last possible moment, opens the face, and late dabs it in the gap between backward point and slip
back of a length and skids into off stump, nurdled with the angle into the midwicket region. Drop and run, smart stuff
Williamson jumps off the ground to meet a short ball outside off. Cut firmly to sweeper
good length on a sixth-stump line outside off, Taylor has nothing to do with it
back of a length, accompanied by extra bounce outside off, Taylor jabs at the ball. The feet stapled to the crease, the hands do all the work as the ball rolls down to third man

tossed up and angled in, Shakib belts out a massive appeal. Taylor pre-meditates, sweeps, and places it fine on the leg side. Straight off the bat and the ball rolls away. What was Shakib appealing for? Beats me
this one stops on the batsman, chipped down to long-on
arm ball, pushed back down to the right of Shakib
another huuuuge appeal for lbw from Shakib. At least this one pinged the pad. Taylor steps out, slides in with the arm, but this was heading down leg
drifts in full, Taylor walks at the bowler plays all around his front pad, Shakib does not appeal this time. This was heading down leg too with the angle from over the stumps
worked with the angle to square leg for one
very full and outside off, angles away further, past the guideline. Off-side wide
overpitched and outside off, Williamson stylishly leans into it and caresses it past cover, beats the man in the deep to his right
tucked off the hips to long leg for one
short of a length and angling away, Mustafiz hits the deck, hint of extra bounce, Taylor hops and fends
good length and slanted across off, Taylor lets it pass
much shorter and closer to off, but still does not draw a response from Taylor
full on off, Taylor shuffles across a touch and drives it right back to Mustafiz, who makes a tumbling save to his right
slides outside off, slightly short, chopped out to point
straight ball on off, defended to cover on the front foot
skips out, meets the pitch and drives through the line through cover
short and angled in, a back-foot punch to wide long-on ensues
short and skids in on off, goes back and plays it back to the bowler
another arm ball, which is tickled to Mustafiz at short fine leg, who fumbles, gifting a single
straying into the hips, picked off through square leg
back of a length on off, Williamson quells it to cover
good length and angling across off, Williamson has plenty of time to dab it down to third man
back of a length on off, tucks 'em up for room, defensively played back to the bowler
looks like the slower cutter outside off, patted down down the ground
another whippy offcutter, 120ks, Taylor picks it. Tips to cover and scurries across to the other end
flatter on the pads, clipped to the right of midwicket. The fielder flings to his right and stops the ball
short and angled in on leg stump, forced to mid-on
slower and outside off, driven out to sweeper
full, straight, accurate stuff. Played back to Shakib
Taylor marches down the track, this is much slower through the air, check-driven to long-off
Williamson uses his feet, arrowed in at leg stump, smartly turned through midwicket
good length, angling around off, opens the face and late-dabs it to point
slower, and overpitched outside off, Williamson spots the change-up, eases forward and drives it regally past the left of the bowler. Languid. Capture that pose and store it forever
good length and outside off, run away to point
clipped off the hips to square leg
another offcutter outside off, opens the face and directs it to square-ish third man
very full and angled across off, forcing drive just wide of mid-off
pushed through on off, gently defended onto the pitch
very full on off, walks out and drives a single to long-off
muscled from Williamson. Very full on off, swatted away over the top, up and over midwicket
speared on middle and leg, punched out to mid-on
slower through the air on off, Williamson backs away and drives it inside out to long-off
skids in on middle, no turn, whisked away to midwicket
angled into the pads, whipped to deep square leg
full and angled in on off, whipped again, this time to deep midwicket
good length around off, run away to point

oooh! Rubel does a Wood. Brute of a ball, jumps from a length outside off, pokes Williamson's eye Williamson adjusts to the extra lift and steers it down to third man. Well played, Williamson brings up another fifty
banged in short and outside off, front-foot pull to the left of deep square leg

full and outside off, squirted past point. Bam! Taylor and Rubel ram into each other. The fielder in the deep swoops down on the ball. Taylor almost head-butted Rubel while setting off for the second run. They eventually decided against it. Williamson dives back into the crease
down the track and laced to cover
steps out and eases it through cover again
shorter and quicker outside off, punched out to sweeper
gallops down the track and pushes the shorter one to long-off
full and outside off, driven crisply but straight to cover
short and wide outside off, Williamson extends his hands and cuts to sweeper
back of a length and angled in on off, run down straight of mid-on for one. Soft hands
length and angled in on off, worked with the angle to the right of midwicket
back of a length and angled in, shuffles back in the crease and milks it to long leg
back of a length and outside off, angled down to deep third man
short and skids in to rap the thigh of Taylor as he hops, skips, flicks.... and misses
back of a length and skids in to rap the thigh of Williamson now
flatter and outside off, down the track and hit to long-off
fired outside off, swept firmly to deep midwicket
what was that? Taylor dances down the track, Shakib sees it and smartly pulls his length back. Hurts it flat on leg stump, the batsman simply kicks it away
angled in, pushed down to mid-on
hangs it up in the air, Taylor reaches out for a drive, tries to manufacture something and skews it in front of midwicket
tossed on off, opens the face and secures a single square through the off side
full and just a shade outside off, glided to point
length and outside off, steered to cover
pitched up on off, closes the face and drives a single straight of mid-on
back of a length on off, Williamson stays leg side of the ball and punches to cover. Tidy bowling from Mashrafe
back of a length and angled in on leg stump, turned straight to midwicket
full on middle, possibly a slower ball, Williamson looks to manufacture a slog. Loses his shape and gets an ugly fat edge to midwicket

pushed through flatter and quicker, beats the sweep and hits the pad, sliding down leg. The ball rolls to short fine leg. Taylor eyes a single but is sent back. A direct hit could have had him despite that full-length dive
full and angled in on off, pushed to mid-on
half-tracker down the leg side, Taylor sizes it up and swings a sweep over backward square leg for the first boundary in five overs
arm ball, extra bounce, beats the sweep

A mix-up between the wickets! This is messy, and Williamson is caught short at the bowler's end. Reward for Bangladesh after building up pressure. This was full and straight, tickled to short fine leg. Mosaddek swoops down on the ball but the throw is off-radar. Shakib adjusts, swivels around, and takes the bails off to dismiss Williamson. Shakib made that throw look a lot better. It was the captain's call, but there wasn't a run in it. Taylor wasn't interested at all. To simply put it: Williamson ran himself out
short and angled in on off, defended on the back foot
extra bounce from a length, splice-jarring ball, kept out
good length and angled in, chipped to mid-on
full and outside off - not a half-volley - eases forward and drives it handsomely past the bowler
length and outside off, square-driven on the front foot for one
full and angled in on off, defensively nudged to midwicket
leg-side wide
clipped with the angle to deep square leg
looped up on off, driven down to long-off
flat and angled in, goes back and whips it past the right of mid-on
full and outside off, driven to the right of short cover. Bangladesh squeezing NZ
full on the stumps, drilled between the non-striker and bowler, to long-on
short and wide outside off, opens the face and punches it to the left of sweeper cover
full and outside off, offcutter, the batsman plays all around his front pad and is hit outside the line of off
slower ball outside off, glided past backward point
back of a length, seam-up, on off, stops on the batsman, who closes the face early, the leading edge just evades Shakib at short cover
wide of the crease, angled in on off, nudged to midwicket
back of a length, slower ball outside off, 113ks, check-pushed to cover
another slower ball, this is bunted down to long-on
back of a length and pushed through flat outside off stump, Broom hangs back and waits to place this late cut past backward point
tossed up at off stump, a short stride and driven to long-off
good length, off stump, poked into the off side for a single
back of a length, slow, angled into the pads. Tucked to short fine
floated full outside off stump, driven out to sweeper cover
drifted in airily, off stump, punched down to long-on
back of a length in the corridor, chopped down to third man to bring up his fifty
good length, slight tail in towards off stump. Broom is a bit clueless about this. Walks into it and makes a stab at it with an angled bat. The ball jams between blade and pads
full and tailing in outside off stump, driven firmly to mid-off where Tamim fumbles. We'll never know if that would've been close
good length at off stump, pushed into the off side on the up
short ball, at off stump, gets on top of it nicely and nails the pull shot straight to deep square
back of a length, angled into the pad and helped down to fine leg
good length, off stump, watchfully pushed back to the bowler with a small stride
yorker at middle stump, forces him to bring the bat down quickly. He does, single through midwicket
offcutter, good length, off stump. Taylor early on the push forward, forced to defend
low full toss outside off stump, a toe-ended bunt into the off side, sweeper cleans up to his right
back of a length, angled across off stump, too close for that cut and he nearly chops this on with it
slower ball, foxes him, a mistimed nothing-shot into the off side
hit-me. Short and wide, barely any fuss to get behind this, some effort to crash it into the turf and past backward point with a cut
back of a length at middle stump, whipped to deep square leg
awkward. This is a bouncer outside off. Taylor wants to pull, then leave, then pull. In the end, it's body swiveling, bat high. The ball strikes it and it's a single on the off side
that's better. Good length at off stump. Brings through a nice batswing and lifts this over the bowler. Couple of bounces into the boundary
full at middle stump, leans into it and drives to pick up a single through long-on
good length, middle stump, thick inside edge on the forward push, short fine to his left
good length, angled across off stump, gets a stride across but he's late on the drive. Straight to mid-off
offcutter, back of a length outside off stump, pushed to sweeper on the up with an open face
full and down the leg side, past the flick
offcutter, back of a length at off stump, watches it closely and defends to point
offcutter, length and across off stump, leaps up and drops it into the leg side
back of a length, offcutter, outside off, tapped to sweeper cover on the up
mistimed slog but he's safe. Doesn't pick this slower ball. It's full at off stump and he looks to lift this to the midwicket boundary. Bat turns and drags it wide of mid-on
length outside off stump, half a stride across to drive it on the up to sweeper
length ball, angled into the pads. Taylor over-reaches, but he can control this flick to get it to deep square's right
a loud appeal for caught behind. Ian Gould might as well be a mannequin. No response from him as he deems that this bouncer has fizzed past Taylor's attempted hook without any connection

good adjustment from Taskin. Taylor goes for a premeditated ramp over fine leg, but he's shuffled across too early. Taskin sees him and digs this back of a length. He makes it a legcutter too. Taylor completely done for timing and is in a pretty poor position. Can only offer this to short fine
bouncer first up, too short, he can duck under it
back of a length, looks to angle it across the left-hander who is behind it to defend nicely
full and wide outside off stump, but this is square drive isn't timed well. Straight to point
offcutter, full at middle stump. Looks to drop this into the off side to steal a single, but he hits it too well
back of a length, grips in the pitch and climbs on him. He lets it come on and turns it into the leg side
bouncer again, too short and too wide, he watches this sail outside off stump
short ball, offcutter, climbs at him and takes his glove as he tries to get on top of this
goes for the yorker, nails the length, not the line. Mushfiqur leaps to his right
back of a length outside off stump, a feeble cut shot, straight to backward point
bursts through his defences, but this is outside off stump. It's length, a bit too full for the pull, Broom goes for it anyway
good length, off stump, defended on the up
back of a length at off stump, swivels and looks to turn it to fine leg, but the angle deceives him. He closes the face too soon, but this evades midwicket
good length outside off stump, punched firmly to mid-off's left
nice. Good length, angled across off stump. He stays deep in the crease and deflects this off the outside half, past where that slip was for him last over
good length, middle stump, pushed to deep midwicket off the back foot
oh what's this. Flat, good length, outside off stump. Neesham wants to flick but this skids through quickly
good length at off stump, pushed down the ground to long-off
good length outside off stump, steps out and doesn't get to the pitch, but adjusts nicely with his wrists to flick this to deep square
good length, middle stump, glanced off the back foot to deep square
back of a length at middle, tucked behind square on the leg side

oh well fielded. Good length at middle stump, leans in and pushes with soft hands towards long-on. Deep midwicket, long-on are converging but it's the bowler, running back, who puts in a slide and forces the batsmen to head back after taking off for a second

ouch. Clear plan to bowl short to Neesham and this is the first one that has been directed properly. Climbs from a leg stump line, stops him from going through with the pull and thumps him on the chest
back of a length at off stump, goes for the pull and nearly misses. Rubel skids on too quickly, but he manages to get an angled bat on this
shot. He's waiting for it now. Stays tall, meets the bouncer nicely in his arc, deposits this to the deep midwicket boundary
shot. Full and wide outside off stump. Was he playing the batsman or has the batsman played him? Drilled past the non-striker
good length at middle stump, pushed to wide long-on
steps out, meets this back of a length ball away from his body, finds sweeper cover

gotcha! Good length, flat, straight, nothing out of the ordinary. Broom steps out, makes a bit of room and looks to slog this over the midwicket boundary. A nice, thick leading edge hands behind square on the off side and the fielders hold their cool. Backward point is given the pleasure, and he makes no mistake
good length, angled into the pads, pushed to deep midwicket on the up

Anderson is trapped on the back leg and he's walking off, but Neesham's called him back. We have a review for lbw. This is pushed through from around the wicket and Anderson is caught on the flick. It hit him in front of leg stump, so the review was warranted given the angle. But Anderson was deep enough for that to be a straightforward decision in the end
good length, off stump, plays with a straight bat, pushes to long-off
back of a length at off stump, pushed into the off side off the back foot
back of a length at off stump, tapped on the up towards long-off. Bowler dives to his right and gets a hand, can't hold on
back of a length outside off, mistimed cut, sweeper gets across quickly
back of a length outside off stump, covers the off stump and lets this go
misfield. Good length ball, pushed harmlessly into the off side where extra cover lets one through
offcutter, back of a length outside off, shovelled down to long-off on the up
too early on the hook. Bouncer outside off stump from around the wicket, hard hands from Santner and an over-eagerness. Misses it by a long way
back of a length outside off stump, stabs at it, gets it down to third man

full and flat at off stump, drives it firmly past his partner, slightly aerially. This runs  quickly away towards the boundary but long-on puts in a last ditch dive to stop it. They come back for a third though, good work all around
good length, middle stump, forward push to midwicket
low full toss fired into the pads, whipped regally, but straight to deep midwicket
makes room, gets followed with a yorker. Jams it out to long-on
good length outside off stump, forward defence into the covers...and a ridiculous loud appeal from behind the stumps

no need to appeal this time! Neesham is a fair way down the wicket. This is another routine flat ball at a length from Mosaddek. It's slightly outside off stump. The batsman runs down the track and is too late bringing his flat-batted shot down at this. It slides under his shot and the stumping is simple
back of a length outside off stump, gets in the air to get on top of the bounce. Hits the ball in the air too, but safely through to sweeper cover
digs this bouncer too short, Milne has time to swing at it, but not quite the height
nearly chips one to midwicket. Good length, angled in a middle stump. He looks to turn this into the leg side, finds midwicket on the bounce
back of a length at off stump, nicely behind it, dabs it towards third man
offcutter, good length at off stump. Clears the front leg and punches to long-off
slower ball, good length at middle stump, flicked to deep square leg's right
good length at off stump, a late, hard-handed push, in the air towards mid-off
quick, slingy, inswinging yorker. Too good for Mline. Inside edge to deep square leg
low full toss, swinging away from the left-hander who has made too much room and missed out on a juicy offering
yorker, just outside off stump. Once more, he's way out of shape after making room and gets his batswing nowhere close. Bisects inside edge and off stump

saved by the inside edge and then by a missed throw. Santner walks across his stumps this time, but can only get an inside edge onto pad. Would have been plumb without the edge. He's also run aimlessly down the track and is forced to dive back into the crease as Rubel misses the stumps
perfect yorkers. Great viewing. Swings away while dipping viciously under his attempted slice through the off side
full at middle stump, clipped off his pads to deep square's right
full and wide outside off stump, flays at it and gets it over the point fielder because of the angle. Sweeper gets across on that large boundary
offcutter, climbs up from a length, and climbs over his attempted cut outside off
delicious. One pacer to another. Milne shuffles across, gets a yorker and his bat can't stop that from crashing into the stumps

Now a run-out appeal. Fizz sends down another top-class yorker that Southee pokes to extra cover. Santner is down the pitch at the other end and is diving back as the direct hit comes in. Shakib, the fielder. Santner's dive is good enough

oh, hello. A boundary! A cheeky one. Walks across the stumps and has his back leg plonked some four stumps away. Then realises this is a slower ball. It's length at middle. He waits for it and flicks it nonchalantly past square leg who is inside the circle
overpitched at leg stump, gets the front leg out of the way and nails this slog...only to find a diving Mortaza at midwicket refusing him a boundary
good thought. Expects the off-stump yorker, goes for the ramp, but the timing is his failing. Gets it with no power to short fine

full toss, starts at leg, ends up off stump. Santner is not picking this, clearly. Goes leg side, closes the face early, gets a big leading edge to third man...who mucks up a simple pick up and gets an earful from the bowler
overpitched on the leg stump, some signs of a loose ball, but Santner can't connect on the flick. Off the pad and to the keeper
away-dipping yorker, fired in at middle stump, jammed back at the bowler
overpitched at middle stump, goes for the heave over midwicket but can't get under it. Gets it off the toe-end to the fielder in the circle there
sa goodwill gesture from Rubel to finish off. A thigh-high full toss at leg stump to Southee who has already shuffled across and is inside the line. Swings hard at it, turns it fine
back of a length and travels in a straight line, no lateral movement, leg-stump ball. Quietly turned to midwicket

Southee strikes with his second ball. Tamim has been given out lbw by umpire Gould. The batsman chooses to challenge the on-field out decision. But this looks pretty adjacent. This was full on middle, lateral movement now, this swings in slightly, enough to bother the left-hander. Tamim falls across, plays down the wrong line. The tracker returns three reds - it would have carried onto hit the leg stump. Bangladesh's gun batsman gone for a duck
full and slipping down the leg side, tickled fine on the leg side. Help-yourself ball to the new man
overpitched and outside off, back-to-back fours. Sabbir strides forward and drives it square, between point and cover. Timing: check. Placement: check
wide of the crease, angled in and straightens away outside off, left alone
change-up, lifter on middle stump, Sabbir has his eyes locked on the ball before ducking under it
he sets to work with a cracker! Good length, angled in, straightens away past the waft. Sarkar was just stapled to the crease, prodding at the moving ball
full and angled into the pads, clipped through square leg
back of a length and angling away outside off, solidly punched to point
back of a length and slanted in, catches the batsman on the shuffle, beats the flick, and raps the front thigh
back of a length, seams back in sharply, the extra bounce harries Sabbir as well. Pings him on the stomach after zipping past the inside edge
short and width outside off, slashed away with hard hands, but Broom makes a sprawling save at backward point to limit it to a dot
full and angling away outside off, Sarkar does not bring his bat down in line, so skews an inside edge to mid-on
back of a length and angling away just outside off, another ginger prod, another inside edge to leg

Sabbir has nicked off. Another cracker, this time from Southee. Good length, angled in, and seams away slightly, not sharply, outside off. Sabbir hangs his bat out in the channel with his feet stapled to the crease, thin-edges it behind to Ronchi, who pouches it. Some start from NZ's new-ball bowlers
back of a length and angled in on off, blocked back to Southee
very full and wide outside off, shapes away further, left alone. Off-side wide
wide of the crease, angled in, and seams away sharply outside off, skirts past the outside edge. Went away like a fast legcutter
good length and angled in on off, defended, head over the ball
another one skirts past the outside edge! Just short of a good length and outside off, holds its line, Sarkar goes searching for it and is beaten.

Did that carry to Guptill tumbling to his right from second slip? He does not claim the catch, he isn't sure. The two umpires converge and refer it to the TV umpire. The soft signal is not out. Boult's front foot is fine. On a length, angled in, and straightens a bit. Sharp extra bounce to go with it, takes the outside edge near the top of the bat. Just drops short of Guptill falling to his right
short and wide outside off, flayed away to backward point
banged in short on the leg stump, cramps the batsman up for room.  Flapped behind to the keeper
back of a length and wide outside off, steered past backward point to square third man
lifter on the leg stump, Mushfiq has been peppered by bouncers all year, he sinks under this safely
back of a length and angling away outside off, stands tall and crisply punches to square cover
full and angled across off, Sarkar vulnerable in the channel, he pokes and watches the ball beat the outside edge. No feet movement at all
back of a length on leg stump, cuts off room, fended square on the leg side

inducker, Sarkar pinned on the back pad and is given! New Zealand's seamers have made short work of Bangladesh's top order. On a good length and skids back in, Sarkar is too late onto it. Southee raps the back thigh in front of middle and leg. Was it bouncing over? The tracker suggests so
full and straight, worked on the front foot through midwicket
full, swings in slightly, Shakib falls over the flick, but think this is heading past the leg stump
full on middle, curves in a touch, Mushfiq now plays across his front pad, eyeing up the leg side, but this isn't threatening the stumps either
digs it short but the line is down leg, leg-side wide
full on off, whipped away to midwicket
snorting bouncer, angling away outside off, Mushfiq evades it, the keeper takes it in front of his head
the short-ball attack continues. 140ks, banged in short on leg stump, kicks up, screams at Mushfiq and clatters into the glove
back of a length and attached with width outside off flayed away to backward point
pitched up and wide outside off, teases Mushfiq into a drive, he ends up chipping the ball over point. He gets off the mark after 10 balls
shortish and outside off, chopped away to the left of cover point
wide of the crease, angled in, and this full ball curls away outside off. Mushfiq ignores it
full and angled in on off, skews a drive to mid-off
Southee ventures wide of the crease again, generates that exaggerated angle, and hits the thigh of Mushfiq
wide of the crease again, angled in on middle, Mushfiq now uses the angle and glances the ball down to long leg
good length and angling across off, Shakib feels for the ball, reaches out with his hands, and watches the ball whistle past the outside edge. Test-match line and length this
back of a length on off, guided to point
good length and swerving down leg, past the flick, wide
back of a length on off, jabbed to point
chest-high short ball on off, Mushfiq takes it on. Swivels on the back foot and hooks to long leg
on a length and outside off, opens the face and pats to point
full on off, defended to cover with soft hands
short and wide outside off, carved down to third man
full and angling away outside off, Shakib drives with firm hands.... and misses
good length and outside off driven on the up to square point
short and angling away outside off, rising ball, Shakib rises with it and upper-cuts it over the cordon
look at the extra bounce! Length and outside off, jumps past the outside edge. Oh wait, replays indicate Mushfiq tucked his bat inside the line
Mushfiq uses his feet, Southee goes wide of the crease, follows him and keeps him to a defensive push
shortish and angled in, worked through square leg for one

dropped by Taylor at wide slip. Good length and slanted across off, Mushfiq jabs at it and manages an outside edge that would have gone down first slip's throat. Instead, Taylor is at a second slip position, he dives to his left with one hand, but the ball bobbles out
fuller than a good length on off, defended
full on off, guided to cover
lifter on the leg stump, Mushfiq ducks under it and lets it thud into the gloves of Ronchi
short and wide outside off, Mushfiq slashes with no feet and misses
Mushfiq evades another short one on leg stump
short and wide outside off, Shakib isn't there whether to play or leave. Wafted to point in the end
yorker - or a near yorker on off - dug out towards mid-off
bouncer, angled in from wide of the crease, Mushfiq ducks under it. It's too high, though, and has been deemed a wide
full and angled in, Mushfiq eyes up a flick, and leading-edges to cover
short and outside off, punched square through the off side
tight line on off, Mushfiq looses his grip and defends to cover
leg-stump ball, milked through square leg
short and outside off, goes back and chops to point
short and outside off, Mushfiq aims to pull it square, ends up flat-batting it over the bowler's head

This 146ks thunderbolt from Milne storms through the gate! The middle stump is floored. Fast bowlers simply love that sight. Good length, starts outside off, and rips back in, Mushfiq wafts at it with no feet again, pace like fire. The quick bursts through the bat-pad gap. Not a memorable birthday for Mushfiq
back of a length and outside off, left alone
full and outside off, a crease-bound Mahmudullah drives through cover point
back of a length and outside off, swishes and misses
Shakib jumps off the ground to meet this short ball outside off. He flat-bats a cut in the gap at cover. Rare confident shot from a Bangladesh batsman. Placed to the left of square point
pitched up and outside off, driven on the up to mid-off hanging back
tight line on off, tip and run to cover
full and angled in on off, defended to point
length ball outside off, Mahmudullah sizes it up and whoops it over midwicket. Elicits cheers from the Bangladesh fans in the stands
short on leg stump, glove-jarring length, fended into the pitch
full and pushed across off, Shakib is halfway forward as he pats it to cover
good length and just outside off, push-driven to mid-off

back of a length and just outside off, pushed to cover, they take on Williamson's arm. Excellent pick up from the NZ captain, a direct hit could have had Shakib at the bowler's end. Santner, I think, backs up the throw
back of a length outside off, 140ks, explodes from the surface, Mahmudullah was looking to play at it, the ball evades his bat and flies to Ronchi
pitched up on off, driven straight of Williamson at mid-off
short ball at middle stump, swivels and check-pulls to deep square
good length at off stump, gets a nice stride forward and taps this into the open covers region
short and wide outside off stump, but it climbs up a touch as he looks to cut, beaten
no extra bounce on the short and wide ball this time, but his cut is weak. Straight to point
back of a length in the corridor, defended to point off the back foot
nicely timed. Overpitched and wide outside off, leans into this and caresses it past mid-off
back of  a length outside off, gets on top of the bounce and nudges this to third man
good length at leg stump, pushed to mid-on off the front foot
good length, just outside off, mistimed drive on the up to mid-off
sweet. Short and just outside off stump, gets the weight transfer spot on and gets on top of this to slap it past midwicket
good length, angled across off stump, punched to mid-off's right for a single
good length at off stump, solid stride forward to defend this
throws his hands at this wide ball, but he finds mid-off with the drive
back of a length, slanted away from the batsman, chopped to third man
gets under this bouncer, but it climbs too steeply for him. In the end, he's tangled as he misses the hook
good shot, no run. Full outside off stump, driven with the full face to mid-off
nicely bowled. Gets another one to climb on the batsman, who is fending a he jumps up. To his credit, he keeps his eyes on the ball and can drop this into the leg side for the single
short outside off stump, pulled off the front foot to deep midwicket's right
back of a length, shape back in, bunted into the turf with a back foot defence
good length, aimed for the top of off stump, defended solidly, right under his eyes
good length, middle stump, pushes at this in front of his body, gets a thick inside edge through midwicket
back of a length in the corridor, looks to run it down to third man, can't make connection good enough to beat gully
oh well played. Overpitched outside off stump, gets to the pitch and thumps this back down the ground
back of a length outside off stump, run down to third man with an angled face
back of a length outside off stump, walks at the ball, drives on the up, straight to mid-off
cuts uppishly, but safely past gully. Third man mops up this short delivery

shot! That's big from Mahmudullah. Incredible power on that after stepping down the track. It was a short delivery, so it had some pace and climb, but his bat swing was so quick. Flying over the square leg boundary
short at leg stump, this time he waits for it to come to him, goes for the pull and bisects fine leg and deep square
goes for the bouncer again, this time it's too short and it's down leg side as well
dropped short outside off stump this time, gets the cut off the middle, finds point
back of a length at off stump, smothers the bounce, uses his wrists to turn this into the leg side
good length ball drifts down leg side, he uses the angle and the inside half of his bat to turn this behind square
follows Shakib down the leg side, tosses it up nicely, then dives to his left to stop the single
floated at the toes, flicked into the leg side, Guptill dives to his left at midwicket
good length, leg stump, pushes forward and cops it on the pad
pushed short and wide, this time Shakib doesn't look to make room. He's manipulated Santner to bowl there after trying to make room for three deliveries in a row. Gets a free cut shot and takes two
back of a length at leg stump, glanced off the hips to short fine
back of a length at leg stump, defended off the back foot
good length outside off stump, driven on the up to sweeper cover
back of a length outside off stump, hurries him on the pull, he checks it to midwicket
bounce. Short and just outside off. Shakib looks to get on top of the ball and guide it down to third man with a closed face, but this climbs over his shot
back of a length at leg stump, glanced in front of fine leg who can't make it in quickly enough or put in a good enough throw to stop the second
short and wide, a nervous aerial cut shot, but it is safe. Sweeper cover runs to his right
good length at off stump, pushed off the back foot, back to the bowler
good length, drifted in at off stump, pushed into the covers off the front foot
pushed through flat, full at middle, inside-edged sweep to long leg
length at off stump, tapped back to the bowler
length at off stump, goes on the back foot, punches against the turn towards mid-on
steps out, beaten in flight, adjusts to poke this in front of short fine
short and wide, gets under this and cuts it uppishly to third man's left
this looked dangerous when he hit it, but he's got it safely to fine leg's right. Anderson went around the wicket and dug a short one into the batsman, who used the angle to ramp it fine
short at middle stump, this time he's in control of the pull, gets it to fine leg's left
length ball wide outside off, punched on the up to sweeper cover
short and just wide of off stump, shuffles back and across, cuts this stylishly, finds third man to his right
slower ball, good length at leg stump, guided down to fine leg with the angle
good length, flat, leg stump. Pushed through square leg with soft hands
good length, angled down leg side, pushed straight to short fine
good length, flat, tickled around to short fine
floated up outside off stump, goes for the paddle, but he's lazy. Doesn't get low for this. Not to the pitch and this bounces up and strikes his helmet
good length, fired in at middle stump, pitches and takes the leading edge on his attempted flick
tossed up at a length outside off, late on the drive, under-edges it into the pitch
uff, solid connection, average placement. Short and wide, sits up nicely, but he cuts to point
great placement this time. Goes leg side to this short and wide ball, rocks back, thumps the pull between short midwicket and mid-on
edged, but it's a thick edge and it's safe. Plays away from the body at this length ball, it runs down to third man
back of a length at off stump from around the wicket, pushed into the off side off the back foot
back of a length at middle stump, shovelled into the leg side, midwicket's there
loose. Very loose from Mahmudullah. Looks to ride the bounce on this short one outside off, then goes for the upper cut. Beaten
tossed up at middle stump, skews the sweep to deep square
full at off stump, drives towards long-off, can't beat the bowler
back of a length at off stump, late on the back foot punch, back at the bowler again
low full toss at middle stump, pushed towards long-on. Midwicket dives and cuts it off, but the single is given
back of a length, down leg side, where Shakib is. Cramps him, forces him to push it back down the pitch
full at leg stump, steps out, nearly yorks himself. Looks to drive this to long-on but Santner is in the way yet again
good length outside off stump, driven on the up to sweeper cover
short at middle stump, nicely controlled pull, along the floor to deep square
bouncer outside off stump, nicely under this and gets this upper cut wide of third man, but not quite with enough power
glorious. Leans into a length ball outside off, transfers the weight forward, offers a nice high elbow and gets the drive wide of mid-off
leaves this one alone, too wide for him. Composure
sees a full ball at middle stump, hands get hard because there's a huge gap on the leg side. But his eagerness affects his timing and he can only chip this wide of mid-on
back of a length at off stump, waits for it to turn, then punches to long-off
good length at off stump, skips down the wicket, pushes towards long-off
tossed up generously, draws him forward and beats him in flight, forces him to push it to extra cover
no, no. Gifted runs. Full and down leg side. It doesn't turn and Ronchi can't get across
back of a length at middle stump, whipped to deep square
back of a length at middle stump, dropped into the leg side off the back foot
back of a length at leg stump, pushed into the leg side off the back foot
good length, angled in at leg stump, defended into the leg side
back of a length outside off stump, pushed to point with an open face
bouncer at middle stump, way, way above the batsman
offcutter, full outside off stump. Looks to drive this through the covers, it trickles through to mid-off
back of a length outside off, makes him leap off the ground to defend
good length at off stump, pushes at it, gets it off the outside half to third man
and now they can cheer again. Back of a length outside off stump, opens the face to run it down to third man to bring up his fifty and hundred runs for the partnership
short and wide, cut straight to point
short and wide outside off, this time he keeps the balance and cut this in front of sweeper cover
swipe and miss. Good length, dipping outside off, and turning rapidly away from the sweep
looped up at off stump, driven to long-off with some poise
good length at off stump, walks across the stumps and uses the turn to push this behind square leg
oh shot. This is floated outside off, he gets to the pitch and drives this past extra cover. Long boundary there, long-off gets across
full and wide outside off stump, driven to sweeper cover with an open face
misfield. And another one. Offcutter outside off stump, carves this on the up, Guptill lets it through at point and Southee fumbles at sweeper
full offcutter outside off stump, driven to sweeper cover
low inswinging full toss at middle stump, clipped to midwicket
bouncer at middle stump, doesn't control this pull, but there are no fielders square in the infield to take that
back of a length outside off stump from around the wicket, gets behind this and slices it wide of third man and that's fifty for him as well
full outside off stump, steps out and takes it on the full, hits it back to the bowler
short and wide outside off stump, cut to sweeper cover
huge! Only just clears the long-on boundary though. Gets down the track, meets this at the pitch and lifts it cleanly over the fielder at the long side of the ground there
full outside off stump, gets to the pitch, drives to sweeper cover
meets it on the full but this time he hits it so hard, there's no question of the bowler stopping that. Gets out of the way, makes a path for Shakib's shot to find the boundary
good length at leg stump, pushed to deep midwicket off the back foot
back of a length, angled into the pads, pushed into the leg side with soft hands
back of a length outside off stump, watches it on to the bat as he deflects this to third man
offcutter, tossed up at a length wide outside off stump, feebly pushed into the off side
full at off stump, tapped to mid-off to steal a single
yorker tails in sharply, thuds him on the pads as he looks to whip this away
good yorker. But well played. This is headed for his toe, but he gets it out of the way and jams it out
tossed outside off, presses forward and drives through the covers
flat and arrowed in on off, defended back on the back foot
turn and bounce for Santner! Starts outside off and breaks away past the big drive
slower through the air but overpitched outside off, stretches forward and drives crisply to sweeper
flatter and faster as Shakib gallops down the track. The batsman, however, does well to adjust by opening his face and dabbing to cover point
short dart outside off, square-cut away for a single
Boult tears in from around the wicket, bouncer, angled in, flies through to Ronchi as the batsman evades it
follows the bouncer with a very full ball on off stump, which is driven smoothly to long-off. Mahmudullah read the chage-up well - shows he is switched on
Shakib steps away outside leg in a bid to open up the off side, but the left-arm seamer follows him. Shakib ends up dragging a heave to midwicket
Boult goes for the yorker but it goes wrong. Very full and slanted down the leg side past the flick. Leg-side wide
short and width outside off, Shakib is excellent off the back foot. Gets on top of the bounce and middles a cut to square-ish third man. Bangladesh now need less than 100 to win
picked off through square leg for one more
wide of the crease, slower ball on off, Mahmudullah spots it, spots the opportunity for a single. Drops it in front of cover and sets off. Whisks Shakib across for a single
backs away outside leg, fetches it from leg stump, open-faced drive through point
Shakib runs down the track, is beaten in flight, but adjusts and drags it to midwicket
tossed up outside leg, Shakib goes low, sweeps, and does not make contact
short and angled across off stump, Shakib strongly cuts it past backward point
tossed on middle and leg, bunted to long-on
length-ball breaks away outside off, pushed to cover-point
hip-high short ball on the leg stump, Shakib rolls his wrists and controls a pull square of long leg
top-edged over the keeper's head; one-bounce four. Short and just outside off, rushes Mahmudullah into a hook. Miscued high and fine for four
140ks inducker. Pitches outside off and cuts back in menacingly, bursts through the gate, and bounces over the stumps
short and wide outside off, jumps off the ground and cuts it out to Anderson at square-ish third man
back-of-the-hand slower ball, Milne forced to dig deep into his reserves. But slips it down leg. Re-set the radar
length ball outside off, serenely pushed through the covers
just short of a good length and outside off, Shakib rides the bounce and secures a single to deep third man. Bangladesh chipping away at the target
clipped off the hips through square leg for one
short and spins away a bit, goes back and punches straight to cover
skids through outside off, eased to long-off
full on the stumps, whipped with the wrists through square leg again
short of a length and angled in on leg stump, back-foot force to long-on
down the track and whipped straight to midwicket
legcutter outside off, late-cut to point
attempts a legcutter outside off, wild ball, slips it a long way down the off side. Mahmudullah chases it before realising he can't reach it
full on middle and leg, clipped away to wide mid-on
banged in short on off, swatted to deep midwicket
just short of a good length on off, dropped defensively to cover
good length on off, forward and bunted straight to cover
back of a length, angled in on off, straightens away ever so slightly, played to point with soft hands
looped up on middle stump, not that full, Shakib stretches forward and controls a sweep through square leg
Mahmudullah pre-meditates by stepping away outside leg. This is shorter and spins away. Mahmudullah goes over the top, but long-off runs to his left and mops up
Santner holds this back and finds turn, dabbed with the turn to cover
slider on off now, no turn, eased down to long-off
short and wide outside off, slapped away past backward point to third man
tossed on off, the length is pulled back as Shakib uses his feet. Worked to midwicket
just short of a good length on off, Southee hits the bat hard, Mahmudullah limply flaps it in the air... but to the right of Guptill at midwicket
short and wide outside off, Shakib extends his hands as far as he can, still can't touch it, nearly a wide. Cross-seamer from Southee

Shakib hares down the track, Southee shortens his length and offers width. Shakib laps it up and smites it through the covers. Rasping flat-batted cut. Picked the slower ball/rather adjusted to the chage-up and dispatched it
another slower ball on middle and leg, Shakib waits for it and swings a sweep to wide long-on
Mahmudullah rides the bounce of this shortish ball outside off and runs it away fine of deep third man
Mahmudullah now races down the track, meets a short ball, muscles it only as far as deep square leg
Mahmudullah shuffles outside leg, length ball on off, smites it past the bowler, hits it straight of long-off
uses his feet, beaten in flight, and is hit on the pad
pitches outside off and breaks away past the guideline, left alone, wide called
full on middle and leg, milked through vacant midwicket. This is now the highest stand for Bangladesh for any wicket in ODIs

Mahmudullah backs away, this ball heads towards the stumps, Mahmudullah punches it through vacant midwicket. The area was open and ripe for picking. He scurries back for the second makes it with a full-length dive
short and spins away outside off, slices a cut, does not carry to Taylor at backward point
flatter and spins away outside off, punched square through the off side
good length and angled down leg, another leg-side wide
and again! Bangs another one down leg
short and wide outside off, lashed to Broom at backward point
hip-high short ball on off, swivels on the back foot and stylishly pulls to long leg
risky, risky. Back of a length on middle, Shakib dares to cut from off stump. He late-cuts it to deep third man. He wasn't in control. He knows it, as does Southee. They exchange wry smiles
ripping yorker on off, dug out to the leg side, adjacent to the pitch. Southee tears in and flicks it onto the stumps, but Shakib makes his ground
slower, short ball outside off, Shakib waits for the ball to arrive, thumps it on the up, drops in front of a diving Guptill at cover. Bursts through him, rolls away to the boundary
dug in short on off, cuts from the stumps again, guided down to third man. Bangladesh are bossing this
hip-high short ball on leg stump, swatted away to long leg
short ball, angled in at the ribs, leaps off his feet and upper-cuts it fine of third man. Excellent execution
good length and slanted across off, flashes and misses
bouncer angled across off, arches his back and lets it pass to the keeper
slower ball on off, opens the face and steers it to point
full on middle and leg, calmly pushed to wide mid-on hanging back
Shakib steps away outside leg, the bowler follows him, swatted to deep square. Raises the 200 stand. First ever for Bangladesh in ODI cricket. The fans cheer Mahmudullah and Shakib on
very full and slanted down leg, another wide
slower ball around off, dabbed wide of backward point
Shakib steps away outside leg, this is pretty full at off, full enough for Shakib to get under it and launch it over mid-off who is inside the circle. Quality shot. Quality innings
Shakib steps away outside leg again, this is short and hurled at his head, sails over it and the hook
short and really wide outside off. Shakib throws his bat at the ball... and misses
short and outside off, short-armed away to deep square leg
full on the stumps, not a yorker, played back to the bowler
full and outside off, opens the face, taps it to point. Shakib moves onto 99
short and wide outside off, flayed straight to backward point
full and angled in on leg, tickled away fine. Mahmudullah hunts for two but Shakib sends him back. Given as leg bye

There it is! A famous hundred for Shakib Al Hasan. Hundred under pressure. Banged in short on leg stump, chest-high ball, he just helps it over fine on the leg side. It goes all the way. Fitting way to raise the milestone
full on off, drilled to mid-off for one more
Shakib backs away outside leg, the bowler follows him. Shakib belts it towards the sightscreen. What a shot
Shakib steps away outside leg again, Boult does not chase him now. Instead puts it short and wide outside off. This is flat-batted fiercely through the covers

Shakib swings... and misses. The stumps are rattled but Bangladesh are all but home. Full on off and middle, he backs away outside leg, looks to smack it away but loses his shape and his off stump. The record 224-run stand is over. Crumbs of consolation for NZ
full-toss, angling away outside off, carves it to the right of deep third man for two
length and angled across off, steered straight to third man. Just one

Mahmudullah raises his hundred with a boundary. This almost cleared the long boundary. He celebrates the milestone with the sajdah. Not sure how I can describe this gesture. He points to his bat repeatedly and looks at the dressing room. Back of a length on the leg stump, launched over square leg
back of a length and outside off, guided to gully

Bangladesh have done it! They have done it again in Cardiff! They have KO'd NZ this time. Full and outside off, reaches out with his hands and flashes it in the gap between slip and gully. Yes, the man who set it up closes it out. How fitting! Mosaddek roars after the famous win. Mahmudullah has his hands aloft in utter delight
